description:
## Top-Level Model Registration

Register a complete Earth system model.

**Prerequisites:**
- All model components must be registered (each creates component + component_config)
- Model family must be registered (if used)

**For CMIP7:** This name will become the model's **source_id**.

See the [EMD Specification](https://wcrp-cmip.github.io/Essential-Model-Documentation/) for detailed guidance.

label: Model Name
description:
The name of the top-level model.

Should include model family and version.

**CMIP7**: This becomes the source_id.

label: Model Family
description:
The model's family name.

Models in a family share code but differ in resolution, parameters, or components.

Leave as 'Not applicable' if no family.

label: Scientific Description
description:
Scientific overview of the model.

**Must mention ALL component types:**
- **Dynamic components**: Brief overview (details in component registrations)
- **Prescribed components**: Explain treatment
- **Omitted components**: Note absence

Example: 'CNRM-ESM2-1 includes atmosphere (ARPEGE-Climat), ocean (NEMO), land surface (SURFEX), with embedded atmospheric chemistry, aerosols, sea ice, and ocean biogeochemistry. Land ice is omitted.'
placeholder: Describe the model covering all component types...

description: ## Model Components\n\nDefine which components are dynamic, prescribed, or omitted.

label: Dynamic Components
description:
Components that are dynamically simulated.

**At least one required.**

Must already be registered via Model Component issues.

label: Prescribed Components
description: Components with prescribed values (inputs).\n\nLeave empty if none.

label: Omitted Components
description: Components wholly omitted.\n\nLeave empty if none.

## Component Configurations

List the component_config IDs from your Model Component registrations.

One ID per line in format: {domain}_{component}_{h_grid}_{v_grid}

**Must have one config for each dynamic component.**

label: Component Config IDs
description:
Enter component_config IDs, one per line.

**Must match your dynamic_components** (one config per dynamic component).

Format: {domain}_{component_id}_{h_grid}_{v_grid}

You received these IDs when you registered each Model Component.

## Embedding Relationships

Define which components are embedded in others.

**Embedding**: Component A is tightly integrated within Component B
- Runs inside host's integration loop
- Often shares host's grid
- Cannot be coupled with other components
- Can have nested embedding (A in B, B in C)

**Format**: One pair per line as `embedded,host` (using component types)

Leave empty if no embedded components.

label: Embedded Components
description:
Enter embedded component pairs, one per line.

Format: embedded,host (using component types)

Example:
aerosol,atmosphere
atmospheric-chemistry,atmosphere
sea-ice,ocean
ocean-biogeochemistry,ocean

## Coupling Relationships

Define groups of mutually coupled components.

**Coupling**: Components that directly exchange information
- **ONLY superior host components** (those NOT embedded) can be coupled
- Components in a group are ALL mutually coupled
- Can have one or more coupling groups

**Format**: One group per line, components comma-separated (using component types)

**Examples:**

Fully coupled (3-way):
```
atmosphere,land-surface,ocean
```

Multiple groups:
```
atmosphere,ocean
land-surface,land-ice
```

4-way coupling:
```
atmosphere,land-surface,ocean,land-ice
```

label: Coupling Groups
description:
Enter coupling groups, one group per line.

Each group = all mutually coupled components (comma-separated).

**Only list superior hosts** (non-embedded components).
## Calendar and Release

label: Calendar(s)
description:
Calendar(s) defining permitted dates.

**List most commonly used first.**

For CMIP7: Only calendars used in CMIP7 simulations.

label: Release Year
description: Year the model was released or first used for published simulations.

## Model References

DOI URLs for publications describing the model as a whole.

Component-specific references go in Model Component issues.

label: Reference DOIs
description: Enter DOI URLs, one per line.\n\nDirect DOI URLs only (https://doi.org/...).
## Issue Handling Metadata

label: Issue Kind
description: Select whether this is a new submission or modification of existing entry.
